intro: Phyllanthus durus, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has a compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant. Phyllanthus durus is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
